law.catch_line: The Authority may authorize the issuance of federally tax-exempt or federally taxable revenue bonds ...

text.section: The Authority may authorize the issuance of federally tax-exempt or federally taxable revenue bonds by resolution.
The Authority may issue the bonds at one time or in one or more series from time to time.
The bonds may be redeemed before maturity at the option of the Authority at the prices and under terms and conditions that the Authority sets before the bonds are issued.
An officer's signature or facsimile on a bond remains valid even if the officer leaves office before the bond is delivered.

section.section: The Authority shall sell the bonds either by competitive or negotiated sale in a manner and for a price that the Authority determines to be in its best interests.
The bonds are exempt from §§ 8-206 and 8-208 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
Before it prepares definitive revenue bonds, the Authority may issue temporary revenue bonds meeting the requirements of this section that are exchangeable for definitive revenue bonds when issued.
The Authority may replace bonds that are mutilated, lost, or destroyed.

The Authority may issue replacement bonds or bonds exchanged for temporary revenue bonds without:
another proceeding; or
the satisfaction of any other condition.
If the proceeds of the bonds are less than the amount required for the purpose for which the bonds were authorized, the Authority may issue additional bonds to fund the amount of the deficit.

Unless otherwise provided in the resolution authorizing the issuance of bonds or in the trust agreement, the additional bonds are:
considered to be of the same issue as the first issue; and
entitled to payment from the same funds as the first issue, without preference or priority of the bonds of the first issue.
The resolution authorizing the issuance of bonds may provide for the issuance of additional bonds to pay the cost of any necessary improvements.

The additional bonds:
may be limited in amount by the resolution or trust agreement;
shall be considered part of the first issue authorized by the resolution; and
shall be issued under the restrictions and limitations provided by the resolution or trust agreement.
